ygData.subject: Re: Hand to hand?????
ygData.msgSnippet: I think my HtH skill is up around the high 20 s now and my max damage is 5 with a strength of 80. I think that grouping is about the only way to practice it.
ygData.messageBody:
I think my HtH skill is up around the high 20's now and my max damage is 5
with a strength of 80. I think that grouping is about the only way to
practice it. Going solo would prolly get you spanked by anything that would
actually raise your skill since it would take a while longer to kill it and
healing will only be doing 2 add'l points with the lute.

Well... It might be practicable with dual wield. I don't know. I'm still 2
and 1/2 bars away from that little gem.

Good Journey,

Sineras (Cazic-Thule)

-----Original Message-----
From: Lea G [mailto:keylimes@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 29, 1999 7:19 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] Hand to hand?????


From: "Lea G" <keylimes@...>

There are many times, I simply hate to abandon my instrument and
equip my heavy weapon. I would love to continue pounding my drum and
punch my enemy in synchrony with the beat of my tune. However so far,
my delicate hands yield very little damage, unless holding a weapon.
I was wondering if any fellow bard has an excellent hand to hand
skill. Is it worth practicing? What is the most damage that can be
inflicted with ones bare bard hands?
Visha of Karana
